thread.title: Google's Pixel 2 happening soon, alongside a cheaper Pixel
thread.title_full: Google's Pixel 2 happening soon, alongside a cheaper Pixel

author: Erna Mahyuni
title: Google's Pixel 2 happening soon, alongside a cheaper Pixel
text:
Google's Pixel 2 happening soon, alongside a cheaper Pixel A more budget-friendly Google phone could soon appeal to your wallets 30 January 2017 / 13:20SGT 
Google's Pixel phones have gotten pretty good reviews and rumours are that a Pixel 2 is on the way, as well as a cheaper pocket-friendly model. More choice 
Seems Google might play catch-up on some features, considering waterproofing the Pixel 2 though that has yet been confirmed. 
The Pixel 2 will have a lot of attention paid to the camera, with even better low light capabilities. As for the processor, it could either be using Qualcomm's Snapdragon 83X chips or perhaps Intel's. Word is that MediaTek was also bandied about but dropped in favour of Qualcomm and Intel's chips. 
Google had also been experimenting with creating its own custom chipset but that might just be in testing and might not come to the Pixel 2. 
Bad news: it might cost at least US$50 (S$75) more than the current model. 
As for the cheaper phone model codenamed the Pixel 2B, it would be cheaper, have less high-end specs as well as being targetted to different markets. So perhaps Southeast Asia is a possible destination for the phone but it's likely Google might prioritise markets such as India and China. 
Still wondering if you want to fork out money for the current Pixel? Check out what we thought of the Google Pixel.
